newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela not planning change of forex bands - Casas.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela not planning change of forex bands - Casas.

text.p: The Venezuelan Central Bank is not planning on changing its foreign exchange bands system in the immediate future, although the system is under study, Central Bank President Antonio Casas Gonzalez said Wednesday.
"We are studying various alternatives...But for the moment the bands system continues the same," Casas told reporters.
The Central Bank has operated a foreign exchange bands system since July 1996. Under the system the exchange rate is allowed to fluctuate up to 7.5 percent either side of a central parity.
Sharp currency movements last week led to calls from some sectors for the bands width to be reduced to about five percent to limit currency swings.
